result.execSummary:
The defendant Marleaka M Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud/Innkeeper,etc-Nonpayment (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.21(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid (jointly and severally) to TGIG as a condition of probation.   Bail to be applied.  Paid in full.
Bail applied to costs.  Any remaining costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Participate in school/work if possible, to be determined by Agent.

No contact with Brookfield Square TGIF, or co-defendants.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Sign all releases for Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with conditions of probation.  May be served in Dane County, to commence on 11/02/2015 at 5:00 p.m. Last 14 days STAYED to be used at the Agent's discretion.

Read in List

Defendant Marleaka M Jackson in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts 2,3 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations. Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 6 days).  

Term of Probation:  1 Year
Conditions of Probation:	
Sign all releases for Agent;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Participate in school/work if possible, to be determined by agent;
No contact with brookfield square,TGIF, or co-defendants.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Condition Time: 21 days with huber, last 14 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion, may be served in Dane County, to commence on 11/2/2015 @ 5:00 pm.  
Restitution: $161.70 joint and several,  to be paid to TGIF, bail to be applied first
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation, remainder of bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
